page.title: 13HOUSING IN CALLANDER
page.content: Most of the houses in this area were built this century but some 18th and 19th centurydwellings have recently been modernised.Some of the{earliest {buildings exist}in part.The letter and barred window of the first P.O.may be seen in Ancaster Square.Nearby,No.1 has retained the marriage lintel. Main St.----Milton House and Murdiston are 18th C.but many,like Kinnell House and the Ancaster Arms are Victorian.A typical feature are walls of "plum and pudding"stone and{slate roofs. {Bridgend}has some of the oldest houses in Callander.The hotel dates from the 17th C.Ivy Cottage has the trademark of its owner over the door and Acharn has the McNab crest. In contrast the new Mollands estate with modern houses,using modern techniques and designs,with roughcast walls and tiled roofs.
